meanings.definition: The act of tripling or making threefold.
meanings.sent1: The triplication of her joy was evident in her wide smile.
meanings.sent2: The triplication of the number of students in the class made it feel crowded.
meanings.sent3: The triplication of ice cream flavors made choosing just one a difficult task.
meanings.sent4: The triplication of his workload left him feeling overwhelmed.
meanings.sent5: The triplication of the stars in the night sky was a breathtaking sight.

meanings.definition: A group of three similar things or people.
meanings.sent1: The trio formed a triplication of talented musicians.
meanings.sent2: The triplication of trees in the park provided ample shade.
meanings.sent3: The triplication of siblings always caused mischief in the house.
meanings.sent4: The triplication of colors in the painting created a harmonious blend.
meanings.sent5: The triplication of birds on the wire chirped in unison.

meanings.definition: To make three times as much or as many.
meanings.sent1: She decided to triplication her savings by working extra hours.
meanings.sent2: The chef had to triplication the recipe to cater to the large party.
meanings.sent3: His attempt to triplication his speed on the track ended in exhaustion.
meanings.sent4: The company aimed to triplication its profits by the end of the year.
meanings.sent5: The magician's trick seemed to triplication the number of cards in his hand.
